title: Father’s Day Activities in San Francisco
seo_title: Father’s Day Activities in San Francisco
meta_description: Father’s Day Activities in San Francisco
long_description:
Father’s Day Activities in San Francisco

 

Are you celebrating your father, grandfather, uncle or yourself this Father’s Day and want to do something fun and different? Instead of making brunch the main attraction, check out some of our favorite Father’s Day Activities in San Francisco! We promise you will have a blast spending time with loved ones and enjoying San Francisco.

 

Stern Grove Free Concert

Celebrating a music love this Father’s Day? Then take them to the Stern Grove Free Concert to hear Janelle Monáe and Midtown Social. The concert starts at 2pm but you will want to get there early to secure a spot because it gets crowded! June 19 kicks off the summer series with free concerts every Sunday through August 21. View the full schedule here.

 

NBA Finals- Warriors versus Cavaliers

The NBA Finals are always exciting but with our Golden State Warriors and League MVP Stephen Curry playing for consecutive championships against the Cavs, things are going to get heated. Watch the game in your comfortable hotel room or in our lobby bar. The city will be getting loud so join in on the fun.

 

Off the Grid Picnic in the Presidio

Summer is officially here when Off the Grid Picnic in the Presidio starts. Take your food-loving father to try all of the best food trucks from around the Bay Area. Make sure you pack a blanket, sunscreen, a frisbee, and some cash!

 

Bike the Bridge

Want to explore even more of San Francisco? Book our Bike the Bridge package so you can hop on one of our hotel bikes and get out there! Our favorite destination is the Golden Gate Bridge. Pedestrians walk on the east side and bicyclists write on the west side so you will feel like you have the bridge to yourself. Enjoy brunch in Sausalito before your return trip. It is a favorite for all ages.
